title: Accesso al server imapmail.libero.it con nome utente non riuscito

creator: derosa.oreste

title: Some values are not stored in profiles, so where?
content:
Hello,

I just copied my whole profile folder from a Debian 12 (Thundebird 115.7) to a Ubuntu 22.04 (Thunderbird 115.8). I expected when running it, to find it in the exact same state because, as what I'm aware of, everything is stored in the profile and nowhere else on the filesystem.

But, I found that: - my favorite folders (around 10) weren't there (well, only 1 of them) - A lot of mails were in "unseen" state (not the unread/read marker, but that star that appears the first time you open a folder for mails that has just been downloaded), where they were already seen

So my concern is about where/how are those values supposed to be stored, and why they don't seem to "migrate" as well? And, may there be some other things that didn't come too?
creator: penlo

title: Thunderbird Import from Seamonkey
content:
The Import from seamonkey does not work, it doesn't do anything, select it and the continue button does nothing when clicked.

Everything I have is in Seamonkey Mail (2.53.18.1) and I am trying to get them out. all I want is all my mail folders, don't care about the rest of the settings, all contacts are in my gmail , it's just all the mail folders

You cannot see from the screen shot but clicking the button does totally nothing, all the seamonkey folders are name & name.msf

Thanks in advance

Shaun
creator: mrhamster99

title: There is now a new line of all my emails just below the T/bird menu.
content: There is now a new line of all my emails just below the T/bird menu. I hate it! How can I revert to seeing all emails separately in the main email body and losing that line?
creator: peter763

title: Does TB now allow you to edit SUBJECT lines?
content:
Been using TB since before it was Eudora. I am still on rev 60-9-1. I use an AddOn that allows me to edit the subject line - this is an ESSENTIAL function, since senders do not use any orderly system for the subject, and I need to change it around in order to search & find them later.

When was it made an integral function - and if not, by now, why the hell not?

Seeing lots of grief about rev 115. What other POP mail apps for Macintosh still exist? All web based mail viewers have lousy interfaces, not to mention that you have to download mail one at a time, and then its just a bunch of files on your computer.

If I upgraded from 60-9-1, how high can I go without it creating a new install and having to go thru the process of saving my Profile.ini etc in their hidden directory and putting them into the 'fresh' install ?
creator: s1s1s11

title: Thunderbird. How to switch on delivery notification option as default
content: Hi Community, Please tell me how to switch on as default the Thunderbird delivery notification option. I have Thunderbird installed on two PCs. One has the option checked to always get a delivery status notification; i.e. always on by default. The other PC doesn't have this option checked for default and I have to remember to 'check' the option box each time I send an email. But I can't find where turn 'set' this option or change it! Help please.... regards, Al
creator: arjbn

title: Not showing attachments from gmail
content:
I receive gmail using Thunderbird version 115.7.0

When I open an email from another gmail account with image attachment, it only shows the file name. Example 'image.jpg' but not download or open option for the file.

Problem solved when I changed Message Body from 'Original HTML' to 'Plain Text'.

It's this normal? Is it a problem caused by the sender? Or it there a better way I can handle this at my end?
creator: michaelyuen.i010

title: Send button greyed out
content:
I use Thunderbird 115.8.0 (64-bit) on Windows to check 10 email accounts all on the same server. The setup in Tbird for all accounts is identical. I only have a problem with one account.

The problem is that on one account, after a small number of replies on a thread, the Send button becomes greyed out and emails will not save.

The other email accounts continue to work just fine.

Compacting mailboxes does not fix the issue.
creator: mozilla536

title: Thunderbird rejects my adding my iCloud Account by indicating: wrong password!!
content: Please let me know how to add my iCloud account. I bought a new computer (PC +Windows 11) and had to reinstall everything. I did not have an issue before; my iCloud account was on my Thunderbird platform. What is preventing it from recognizing my password? It finds all the specifications though! Being in Canada, I also have an account with Rogers and installing that one was easy. Thanks for your suggestions and, hopefully, solutions!
creator: veredtlv

title: Nemožnost přijímat i odesílat zprávy z Thunderbirdu
content: Dobrý den, nejde mi pracovat s účtem obchod@darkmont.cz. Nechodí příchozí pošta a ni nelze posílat zprávy, píše to, že odesílání selhalo. Sender address rejected. PC jsem restartovala, ale problém pořád přetrvává i na druhém pc. Prosím o pomoc, e-mail potřebuji v práci. Díky Lenka Širlová
creator: darkmontcz

title: how to copy & save user info & all emails, and copy into a newer rev on another computer
content:
Thinking of buying a refurb Mac made in Jan 2023. They don't say what OSX is installed. If I use Migration Assistant to copy the whole hard drive from my 2011 machine running El Capitan and Thunderbird 60.90.1, I may find that this old version of TB will not function. So I would try to install a newer rev of TB, but not all the way to rev 115.

If I'm lucky, it will not be a "new install" because then I would have to previously find & save the Profile.ini and that other .ini file. I don't remember if I also need to save the actual email data separately, but of course I want that as well. And then I would have to do a complicated process to copy the Users and emails back into the newly installed version. I did this once long ago & don't relish figuring it out again.

However, the process of Migrating and fixing all the Preferences etc on the new computer might take me some days, and in the meantime I would be sending & receiving emails on the old computer. So I would want to take THAT data and stick it in the new machine.

So can anyone tell me if my old rev of TB is likely to function?
creator: s1s1s11

content: My desktop asked for a reboot after installing update Thunderbird. After 4 reboots, it still won't start. I wanted to uninstall it so I would be able to reinstall, but keeps asking for reboot. GRRRRRRR. I can't start my mailprogram anymore, can't uninstall it.. luckily I have a webbrowser.. What can I do to repair it?
creator: Tolstoi

title: Hide images only on some folders
content:
Hello. I recently went back to Thunderbird after having used the default Mail app in Windows 10 and 11 for some time. I am pleased with how it works and intend to now use it as my default email client. However, I am concerned that the option to make images visible in emails extends to the entire program, and emails that my mail providers have identified as spam and sent to a "Junk" folder will show embedded images. This was not an issue with the Mail app in Windows.

This is not good for security and privacy, as displaying images on spam messages is a way for spammers to confirm an account is live and thus continue sending their garbage. Would it be possible to have Thunderbird block images *only* in specific folders of the user's choosing, while still be able to see them in the rest of the user folders?

Thanks.
creator: carnotaur1
